com.milk.objed
Interface ValueEditor

All Superinterfaces:
Editor
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseWrappedValueEditor, DirectValueEditor, FieldValueEditor, MethodValueEditor
public interface ValueEditor
extends Editor

This interface is for editors which are effictively just editing a single value, such as a string or boolean value.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object getValue()
          Get the current value from this editor.
 void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
          Set a new value for the editor.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.milk.objed.Editor
addListener, getDescription, getLabel, isMutable, removeListener, update
 

Method Detail

getValue

public java.lang.Object getValue()
Get the current value from this editor. If this editor is imposing interesting restrictions on the value, and somehow the value doesn't actually abide by the restrictions, this method may throw BadValueException.

Returns:
the current value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value is bad in some way

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
              throws BadValueException,
                     ImmutableException
Set a new value for the editor.

Parameters:
value - the new value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value is inappropriate for this editor
ImmutableException - thrown if the editor is in fact immutable
